solution_line_template: During the weekdays, Paris studies {weekday_hours_per_day} hours a day for {weekdays_per_week}*{weekday_hours_per_day} = <<{weekday_hours_per_day}*{weekdays_per_week}={weekday_hours_per_week}>>{weekday_hours_per_week} hours

She studies {saturday_hours} hours on Saturday and {sunday_hours} hours on Sunday for a total of {saturday_hours}+{sunday_hours} = <<{saturday_hours}+{sunday_hours}={weekend_hours_per_week}>>{weekend_hours_per_week} hours on the weekends

If she studies {weekday_hours_per_week} hours during the weekdays and {weekend_hours_per_week} hours on the weekends then she studies {weekday_hours_per_week}+{weekend_hours_per_week} = <<{weekday_hours_per_week}+{weekend_hours_per_week}={total_hours_per_week}>>{total_hours_per_week} hours per week

There are {semester_weeks} weeks in the fall semester and she studies {total_hours_per_week} hours a week so she will spend {semester_weeks}*{total_hours_per_week} = <<{semester_weeks}*{total_hours_per_week}={total_study_time_semester}>>{total_study_time_semester} hours studying
